meanings.definition: A substance used in printing to form the image on the paper.
meanings.sent1: The toner in the printer helped create clear images on the pages.
meanings.sent2: The office needed to order more toner for the copy machine.
meanings.sent3: When the toner spilled, it looked like a black river flowing across the floor.
meanings.sent4: The toner acted like a magical paintbrush, bringing words to life on the paper.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh toner always reminded her of the busy office.

meanings.definition: A liquid used in skincare to cleanse and tighten pores.
meanings.sent1: After washing her face, she applied toner to refresh her skin.
meanings.sent2: The toner helped remove any remaining dirt from her pores.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the toner was like a tiny vacuum for her face.
meanings.sent4: The toner felt like a cool breeze on her skin, leaving it feeling smooth.
meanings.sent5: Using toner became a soothing part of her nightly skincare routine.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that imparts tone, as in music or speech.
meanings.sent1: The choir director was a skilled toner, guiding the singers to harmonize.
meanings.sent2: His speech coach was an expert toner, helping him project confidence.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his cat was a better toner than he was.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a toner for his soul, lifting his spirits with each conversation.
meanings.sent5: The music conductor was a master toner, bringing out the best in every musician.
